intro: Galium melanantherum var. brevifolium, commonly known as the short-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically less than 2 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its compact foliage and is often found in the understory of temperate forests.
